prompt: If region x is NE of region y and region y is NE of region z, then which could be the possible relations between region x and region z?
answer:
Based on the given constraints:
- x NE y (meaning supx(y) ≤ infx(x) and supy(y) ≤ infy(x))
- y NE z (meaning supx(z) ≤ infx(y) and supy(z) ≤ infy(y))

I can derive:
supx(z) ≤ infx(y) ≤ infx(x)
supy(z) ≤ infy(y) ≤ infy(x)

Therefore:
supx(z) ≤ infx(x) and supy(z) ≤ infy(x)

This precisely matches the definition of the NE relation. When checking all other possible cardinal directions (N, E, SE, S, SW, W, NW, B), they each violate at least one of our derived constraints.

NE
